Atlas quickly became influential within the administration, and Trump welcomed his recommendations such as faster reopening and less testing, which are in accord with Trump's own preferences.<ref name = Cook/><ref name= "NYTSept1" /> Atlas was the only doctor to share the stage at Trump's pandemic briefings in the week after his appointment was announced,<ref name=":1"/> and he has also prepared Trump's briefing materials.<ref name="NYTSept1"/> Trump has publicly disagreed with or reduced the roles of his other members of the [[White House Coronavirus Task Force]], including Birx and Dr. [[Anthony Fauci]],<ref name = Cook>{{cite web | last1=Cook | first1=Nancy | title=Trump elevates Scott Atlas, a doctor with a rosier coronavirus outlook |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2020/08/17/trump-scott-atlas-coronavirus-doctor-396741 | date=August 17, 2020 | work=[[Politico]] | access-date=August 18, 2020}}</ref><ref name="Dawsey">{{cite news|last1=Dawsey|first1=Josh|last2=Abutaleb|first2=Yasmeen|date=October 31, 2020|title='A whole lot of hurt': Fauci warns of covid-19 surge, offers blunt assessment of Trump's response|work=The Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/fauci-covid-winter-forecast/2020/10/31/e3970eb0-1b8b-11eb-bb35-2dcfdab0a345_story.html|access-date=October 31, 2020}}</ref> with whom Atlas repeatedly clashed.<ref name = AlbaLee/> Atlas is said to have alienated Birx and [[Robert R. Redfield]] of the CDC with his controversial ideas.<ref name="NYTSept1" /><ref name="Costa"/> Redfield was heard privately commenting on Atlas that "everything he says is false".<ref name=":2">{{cite news |last1=Alba |first1=Monica |title=Redfield voices alarm over influence of Trump's new coronavirus task force adviser |url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/redfield-voices-alarm-over-influence-trump-s-new-coronavirus-task-n1241221 |access-date=September 28, 2020 |work=[[NBC News]] |date=September 28, 2020}}</ref> When Fauci was asked whether Atlas was providing misleading information to Trump, Fauci replied, without naming Atlas, that "sometimes there are things that are said that are really taken either out of context or actually incorrect".<ref name=":5">{{cite news |last1=Weixel |first1=Nathan |title=Atlas, health officials feuds add to Trump coronavirus turmoil |url=https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/518847-atlas-health-officials-feuds-add-to-trump-coronavirus-turmoil |access-date=September 30, 2020 |work=[[The Hill (newspaper)|The Hill]] |date=September 30, 2020}}</ref> Since August 2020, Birx has avoided meetings where Atlas is present.<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Bennett |first1= Kate |last2=Cohen |first2=Elizabeth |title=Birx cedes White House turf to Atlas while hitting the road to spread her public health gospel |url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/29/politics/deborah-birx-task-force-scott-atlas/index.html |access-date=2020-11-06 |website=CNN}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Dr. Birx vows she won't sit with Trump-picked task force member|url=https://www.cnn.com/videos/health/2020/10/29/deborah-birx-scott-atlas-coronavirus-task-force-bennett-lead-vpx.cnn|access-date=6 November 2020|website=www.cnn.com|publisher=CNN}}</ref>  In an interview with ''The Washington Post'' in late October 2020, Fauci said of Atlas, "I have real problems with that guy. He's a smart guy who's talking about things that I believe he doesn't have any real insight or knowledge or experience in. He keeps talking about things that when you dissect it out and parse it out, it doesn't make any sense."<ref name="Dawsey"/> In mid-November 2020, it was reported that Atlas had not attended White House task force meetings in person since late September amid his clashes with Fauci and Birx.<ref name = AlbaLee/>

During stimulus negotiations in fall 2020, Atlas opposed funds for widespread COVID-19 testing; in an email to an economist, Atlas wrote that the push for testing was "a fundamental error of the public health people perpetrated on the world."<ref>{{Cite news |last1=Tankersley |first1=Jim |last2=Weiland |first2=Noah |last3=Cochrane |first3=Emily |date=2020-10-16 |title=White House Opposes Expanded Virus Testing, Complicating Stimulus Talks |language=en-US |work=[[The New York Times]]  |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/16/business/white-house-coronavirus-testing.html |access-date=2020-10-17 |issn=0362-4331 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201122080029/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/16/business/white-house-coronavirus-testing.html |archive-date=2020-11-22}}</ref> After [[White House COVID-19 outbreak|Trump was diagnosed with coronavirus in early October 2020]], Atlas appeared on Fox News to predict a "complete and full and rapid recovery" for Trump and to urge viewers not to panic.<ref>{{Cite web|date=October 2, 2020|title=Controversial coronavirus tsar accused of playing down pandemic says 'no reason to panic' over Trump diagnosis|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/trump-coronavirus-scott-atlas-diagnosis-recovery-b747030.html|access-date=October 3, 2020|website=The Independent|language=en}}</ref> On October 31, Atlas was interviewed for 26 minutes on a broadcast of the [[RT (TV network)|RT]] network (formerly Russia Today), a Russian state-controlled outlet classified by U.S. intelligence agencies as part of [[Russian propaganda|Russia's propaganda apparatus]]. The next day, Atlas apologized, writing: "I regret doing the interview and apologize for allowing myself to be taken advantage of."<ref name="Treisman">{{cite news |last=Treisman |first=Rachel |date=November 1, 2020 |title=WH Adviser Scott Atlas Apologizes For Interview With Kremlin-Backed News Outlet |url=https://www.npr.org/2020/11/01/930149143/wh-adviser-scott-atlas-apologizes-for-interview-with-kremlin-backed-news-outlet |publisher=[[NPR]] |access-date=November 2, 2020}}</ref> On November 15, Atlas wrote a tweet urging [[Michigan]] residents to "rise up" against the state's newly announced COVID-19 restrictions, which included a requirement that high school and college classes must be conducted remotely and a three-week ban on many indoor activities including restaurant dining.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.clickondetroit.com/health/2020/11/15/here-are-14-changes-going-into-effect-under-michigans-new-covid-19-restrictions/#//|title=Here are 14 changes going into effect under Michigan's new COVID-19 restrictions|last=Hutchinson|first=Derrick|date=November 15, 2020|work=Click On Detroit|access-date=17 November 2020}}</ref> Atlas' tweet included the hashtags #FreedomMatters and #StepUp.<ref name="LeBlanc">{{cite news |last1=LeBlanc|first1=Paul |last2=Diamond |first2=Jeremy |date=November 15, 2020 |title=Trump coronavirus adviser Scott Atlas urges Michigan to 'rise up' against new Covid-19 measures |url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/15/politics/scott-atlas-coronavirus-michigan/index.html |publisher=[[CNN]] |access-date=November 15, 2020}}</ref>

Deborah Birx, the former White House coronavirus coordinator, said Trump was fed 'parallel data' that she hadn't approved. Somebody had been creating graphics for Trump to present "that were not transparently utilized." Scott Atlas, Trump's former advisor on the coronavirus task force and a lockdown skeptic, was involved, she said.<ref>{{cite web |author1=Kate Duffy |title=Deborah Birx, the former White House coronavirus coordinator, said Trump was fed 'parallel data' that she hadn't approved, which he then presented to the public |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/deborah-birx-trump-covid-parallel-data-scott-atlas-2021-1 |website=Business Insider |date=25 January 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author1=Kelly Hooper |title=Deborah Birx: 'Parallel set of data' on Covid-19 was delivered to Trump |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/24/birx-trump-parallel-covid-data-461928 |website=Politico |date=24 January 2021}}</ref>
